question: Will my files be deleted when a system is undergoing a complete data center shutdown?
answer: No, your files will not be deleted. National Host Sites will migrate /project and /home data to new storage systems.

question: What happens to /project and /home data during renewal activities?
answer: Each National Host Site will migrate /project and /home data from the existing storage system to the new storage system once it is installed.

question: When do data migrations typically occur?
answer: Data migrations typically occur during outages, but specific details may vary by National Host Site.

question: How will users be informed about specific effects during data migration?
answer: Each National Host Site will keep users informed of any specific, user-visible effects.

question: Will tape systems for backups and /nearline data be replaced?
answer: No, tape systems for backups and /nearline data are not being replaced, so they will remain unchanged.

question: Who should I contact for further technical questions about data migration?
answer: For further technical questions, email technical support, which goes directly to a ticketing system for a detailed response from a support expert.

question: When will outages occur during the infrastructure upgrade?
answer: Each National Host Site will have its own schedule for outages, described on the system status web page (https://status.alliancecan.ca).

question: How will users receive updates and outage notices?
answer: More general updates will be provided on this wiki page, and users will periodically receive emails with updates and outage notices.

question: Whom can I contact for questions about the transition to new infrastructure?
answer: Contact our technical support, who will try their best to answer any questions.

question: Will my jobs and applications still be able to run on the new system?
answer: Generally yes, but the new CPUs and GPUs may require recompilation or reconfiguration of some applications. More details will be provided as the transition unfolds.

question: Will the standard software environment be available on the new systems?
answer: Yes, our standard software environment will be available on the new systems.

question: Will commercial, licensed software be migrated to the new systems?
answer: Yes, the plan is that current commercial software licenses will be transitioned to the new replacement, aiming for identical access to special applications (e.g., Gaussian, AMS/ADF).

question: Is there any risk regarding commercial software licenses during the transition?
answer: There is a small risk that software providers may change their licensing terms for the new system, which will be addressed individually as issues come up.

question: Will there be staggered outages, or can multiple systems be offline at once?
answer: While efforts will be made to limit overlapping outages, there will probably be periods when several systems are simultaneously offline due to delivery schedules and funding deadlines.

question: How will outages be announced?
answer: Outages will be announced as early as possible.

question: Can I purchase old hardware after the equipment upgrades?
answer: Most of the equipment is legally the property of the hosting institution and is typically e-cycled (recycled) rather than sold, following their disposal guidelines.

question: Who should I contact if I am interested in acquiring old hardware?
answer: It is best to contact the host institution directly, as they may have specific policies or options for selling equipment.
